mdRecord.dcterms:title: Sixth Street streetscape with houses, Garden City
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Alexander Turney Stewart was founder of the Central Railroad of Long Island (now part of the Long Island Railroad). In the 1870s he began building at Hempstead Plains, Long Island, the village of Garden City, with the purpose of affording his employees comfortable and airy housing at a moderate cost. -- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexander_Turney_Stewart [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Architecture and City Planning

Stewart, Alexander Turney (American businessman and collector, 1803-1876)
